channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

item.title: Report X-2023101116
item.description:
Report X-2023101116

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-17T18:14:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-12
  • City: SAINT PAUL
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE FOUND INSIDE TRAILER WET SOILED/STAINED ON SIDES AND TOP OF BOX. DescribePack: CAP ON GLASS 4 LITER BOTTLE CAME LOOSE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: LEAKED ALMOST ALL OF THE LIQUID OUT.

item.title: Report X-2023100648
item.description:
Report X-2023100648

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-14T18:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at station with noticeable leaking contents from package's lid. Immediately placed package into plastic lined tote and added to drain mats in damaged hazmat processing area. DescribePack: Loose lid caused leaking DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Immediately placed package into plastic lined tote and added to drain mats in damaged hazmat processing area.

item.title: Report I-2023100039
item.description:
Report I-2023100039

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-13T18:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-05
  • City: Eagan
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KANE FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver did not notice that this was a vapor-recovery tank even though it was diesel fuel.(Customer took out the mid-grade gasoline product and replaced it with diesel product) The driver failed to lock down the down spout fitting onto the pipe fitting. The tank built up presseure as there was a pressure release vent cap in place, and the least resistanse which was the non-coupled fitting, blew off the pipe fitting, releasing(spilling) product onto the ground. The driver was at the rear of the trailer doing paperwork, rather than at the point of delivery. The fuel ran down hill onto the street and entered the city sewer system. All of the product ran down hill thru the city sewer system about a block and was captured at a holding tank prior to entering a lake. No product entered the lake. Booms where placed and then replaced to collect the spilled product.

item.title: Report X-2023100595
item.description:
Report X-2023100595

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-13T18:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-29
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: damaged package was discovered this morning on the inbound. as it was leaking from the bottom, someone placed it in a lined tote and turned it upside down to stop further leakage. they brought it to the damage area and moved it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: there is a puncture on the bottom of the jerrican. through this small hole, the product can leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: turned upside down, placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats
